briefdescription.para: Create a new SSH buffer.

simplesect.para: A newly initialized SSH buffer, NULL on error.

briefdescription.para: Deallocate a SSH buffer.
Sets the buffer as secure.

detaileddescription.para: A secure buffer will never leave cleartext data in the heap after being reallocated or freed.

briefdescription.para: shifts a buffer to remove unused data in the beginning
Reinitialize a SSH buffer.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, < 0 on error.

briefdescription.para: Add data at the tail of a buffer.

parameterdescription.para: The buffer to add the data.
A pointer to the data to add.
The length of the data to add.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, < 0 on error.

briefdescription.para: Add a SSH string to the tail of a buffer.

parameterdescription.para: The buffer to add the string.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, < 0 on error.

briefdescription.para: Add a 32 bits unsigned integer to the tail of a buffer.

parameterdescription.para: The buffer to add the integer.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, -1 on error.

briefdescription.para: Add a 16 bits unsigned integer to the tail of a buffer.

parameterdescription.para: The buffer to add the integer.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, -1 on error.

briefdescription.para: Add a 64 bits unsigned integer to the tail of a buffer.

parameterdescription.para: The buffer to add the integer.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, -1 on error.

briefdescription.para: Add a 8 bits unsigned integer to the tail of a buffer.

parameterdescription.para: The buffer to add the integer.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, -1 on error.

briefdescription.para: Add data at the head of a buffer.

parameterdescription.para: The buffer to add the data.
The length of data to prepend.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, -1 on error.

briefdescription.para: Append data from a buffer to the tail of another buffer.

parameterdescription.para: The source buffer to append. It doesn't take the position of the buffer into account.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, -1 on error.

briefdescription.para: Get a pointer on the head of a buffer.

parameterdescription.para: The buffer to get the head pointer.

simplesect.para: A data pointer on the head. It doesn't take the position into account.
Don't expect data to be nul-terminated.
buffer_get_len()

briefdescription.para: Get a pointer to the head of a buffer at the current position.

parameterdescription.para: The buffer to get the head pointer.

simplesect.para: A pointer to the data from current position.
buffer_get()

briefdescription.para: Get the length of the buffer, not counting position.

parameterdescription.para: The buffer to get the length from.

simplesect.para: The length of the buffer.
buffer_get()

briefdescription.para: Get the length of the buffer from the current position.

parameterdescription.para: The buffer to get the length from.

simplesect.para: The length of the buffer.

briefdescription.para: Advance the position in the buffer.

internal.para: This has effect to "eat" bytes at head of the buffer.

parameterdescription.para: The buffer to advance the position.
The number of bytes to eat.

simplesect.para: The new size of the buffer.

briefdescription.para: Cut the end of the buffer.

parameterdescription.para: The number of bytes to remove from the tail.

simplesect.para: The new size of the buffer.

briefdescription.para: Get the remaining data out of the buffer and adjust the read pointer.

parameterdescription.para: The data buffer where to store the data.
The length to read from the buffer.

simplesect.para: 0 if there is not enough data in buffer, len otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get a 8 bits unsigned int out of the buffer and adjusts the read pointer.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a uint8_t where to store the data.

simplesect.para: 0 if there is not enough data in buffer, 1 otherwise.

briefdescription.para: gets a 32 bits unsigned int out of the buffer. Adjusts the read pointer.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to a uint32_t where to store the data

simplesect.para: 0 if there is not enough data in buffer
4 otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get a 64 bits unsigned int out of the buffer and adjusts the read pointer.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a uint64_t where to store the data.

simplesect.para: 0 if there is not enough data in buffer, 8 otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Valdiates that the given length can be obtained from the buffer.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK if the length is valid, SSH_ERROR otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get a SSH String out of the buffer and adjusts the read pointer.

simplesect.para: The SSH String, NULL on error.

briefdescription.para: Get a mpint out of the buffer and adjusts the read pointer.

simplesect.para: This function is SSH-1 only.
The SSH String containing the mpint, NULL on error.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct ssh_buffer_struct *buffer, const char *format, int argc, va_list ap)
memberdef.name: ssh_buffer_pack_va

briefdescription.para: Add multiple values in a buffer on a single function call.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success SSH_ERROR on error
ssh_buffer_add_format() for format list values.

briefdescription.para: Add multiple values in a buffer on a single function call.

parameterdescription.para: A format string of arguments. This string contains single letters describing the order and type of arguments: 'b': uint8_t (pushed in network byte order) 'w': uint16_t (pushed in network byte order) 'd': uint32_t (pushed in network byte order) 'q': uint64_t (pushed in network byte order) 'S': ssh_string 's': char * (C string, pushed as SSH string) 't': char * (C string, pushed as free text) 'P': size_t, void * (len of data, pointer to data) only pushes data. 'B': bignum (pushed as SSH string)

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success SSH_ERROR on error
when using 'P' with a constant size (e.g. 8), do not forget to cast to (size_t).

memberdef.argsstring: (struct ssh_buffer_struct *buffer, const char *format, int argc, va_list ap)
memberdef.name: ssh_buffer_unpack_va

briefdescription.para: Get multiple values from a buffer on a single function call.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success SSH_ERROR on error
ssh_buffer_get_format() for format list values.

briefdescription.para: Get multiple values from a buffer on a single function call.

parameterdescription.para: A format string of arguments. This string contains single letters describing the order and type of arguments: 'b': uint8_t * (pulled in network byte order) 'w': uint16_t * (pulled in network byte order) 'd': uint32_t * (pulled in network byte order) 'q': uint64_t * (pulled in network byte order) 'S': ssh_string * 's': char ** (C string, pulled as SSH string) 'P': size_t, void ** (len of data, pointer to data) only pulls data.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success SSH_ERROR on error
when using 'P' with a constant size (e.g. 8), do not forget to cast to (size_t).
